author: cutting
msg: Fix for HADOOP-107.  As they were written, dfs blocks were both trickled to a datanode and tee'd to a temp file (in case the connection to the datanode failed).  Now they're only written to the temp file, with no connection to the datanode made until the block is complete.  This reduces the number of long-lived mostly-idle connections to datanodes, which was causing problems.  It also simplifies the DFSClient code significantly.

author: aheritier
msg: If a report isn't generated the plugin fails trying to replace entities in a not existing file.
